page.title: 10Scaleby Castle
page.content: Scaleby Castle is now the home of the Liberal peer Lord Henley who has owned it for six years since the death of his father. It was begun by Richard de Tilliol (the Rider) in the 12th. century and developed by his family over the years. The castle was garrisoned and beseiged in 1644 and burnt in 1648. Richard Gilpin rebuilt the west half of the south wall in 1685 and his grandson built the porch in 1737. From 1741 the house was unoccupied for many years. Today the castle has been transformed into a family home which is surrounded by a moat and trees. It is approached by a half mile tarmac drive from the Lodge.
